snippet: The suspension of a major stretch of rail line is disrupting one of the busiest transportation corridors in the nation.
abstract: Deadly Amtrak derailment, and subsequent schedule disruptions along one of nation's busiest corridors, have forced travelers and commuters to come up with alternative plans; flights in region are packed with those who can afford tickets, which have become more expensive due to demand; others have been forced to drive or take buses.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and JOHN SURICO
byline.contributor: Nate Schweber and Edna Ishayik contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The suspension of a major stretch of rail line is disrupting one of the busiest transportation corridors in the nation.

headline.main: Travelers Struggle to Change Plans After Amtrak Derailment
headline.print_headline: Northeast Travelers Find Alternatives, Some of Them Very Expensive
